# preferredBehavioralStyle

**Instance Property**

The preferred behavioral style.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var preferredBehavioralStyle: UIBehavioralStyle { get set }
```

## Discussion

Use this property to specify the behavioral style for the slider. If the value of the property is [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIBehavioralStyle/automatic], use the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISlider/behavioralStyle] property to determine the actual style.

The default value for [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISlider/preferredBehavioralStyle] is [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIBehavioralStyle/automatic]. To learn more about behavior styles, see [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIBehavioralStyle].

## Modifying the slider’s behavior

- **isContinuous**: A Boolean value indicating whether changes in the slider’s value generate continuous update events.
- **behavioralStyle**: The style that determines how the slider behaves.
- **UIBehavioralStyle**: Constants that indicate how a control behaves in apps built with Mac Catalyst.
